title: ‘Celebrity Playtime’ showcases anew Billy’s hosting skill
text:
by Crispina Martinez - Belen
October 2, 2015 By now, Kapamilya viewers worldwide must know of the innate hosting skill of Billy Crawford from shows like “It’s Showtime” and “Your Face Sounds Familiar” (“YFSF”), which is on its second season. His success, especially with the latter, merited him another ABS-CBN show titled “Celebrity Playtime” which airs its second episode tonight before “Home Sweetie Home.”
BILLY CRAWFORD
Arnel Natividad, director of “Celebrity Playtime” (and “Tonight With Boy Abunda,” “Family Feud”), said Billy is a perfect fit for his new show.
As for Billy, he said he just delivers the needed energy and vibe in his hosting to make his audience happy. He really loves hosting and the warm interaction he has with his audience.
The new show for him also encourages personal interaction amid the era of social media.
The celebrity contestants featured last Saturday were Melai Cantiveros, Nyoy Volante, Edgar Allan Guzman, and Karla Estrada from the first season of “YFSF” versus some of the lucky stars of “Kapamilya Deal Or No Deal” like Long Mejia, Dennis Padilla, Eric Nicolas and Epi Quizon.
• • •
HOW SAM LOVES
Love the Sam Milby way is simple: it’s all or nothing.
The 31-year-old actor revealed he is ready to settle down and have a family in three to four years’ time. And when he does, there won’t be a prenuptial agreement.
“When you make an oath under God, when you get married, you’re saying kahit kailan hindi tayo maghihiwalay, no matter what happens – the good times and the bad, hindi tayo maghihiwalay,” he explained.
His personal take on the subject of prenuptial agreements is that it could cast a negative vibe on a wedding. Sam doesn’t like that.
SAM MILBY and Jennylyn Mercado, stars of ‘The PreNup’
“Hanggang forever dapat. I do believe in forever. May forever talaga and that’s the Milby way,” he said with a smile.
Sam also believes the right woman for him will come at the right time. This means he is not going to rush into marriage and family life.
“I think pagdating sa pag-ibig it’s something you can’t really rush. Kahit papaano, I’m still very young. But in terms of having a family I’m not rushing (into it). You know I have a lot of blessings; I’m very busy too and I’m happy. That will come when the time is right.”
Sam Milby stars in “The Prenup” with Jennylyn Mercado. By award-winning filmmaker Jun Lana, the movie opens on Oct. 14 in nationwide cinemas.
Aside from “The Prenup,” Sam has already began taping for “Written In Our Stars,” his latest ABS-CBN soap opera. In the works, too, is his 10th anniversary concert set on Nov. 28 at the Kia Theater.
Sam said, “Malaking blessing itong movie working for the first time with a new leading lady. I just feel very blessed that over the years, sobrang daming blessings and sobrang daming leading ladies I’ve been able to work with.”
